reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Le Petit Hotel "upgraded" (in their own words) us to this hotel due to the construction next door to our would-be room which starts at 7:30am. This hotel is beautiful, just 3-5 minutes from the train station and most of the restaurants and sports shops (and so a bit of a walk from the lifts). Most/all rooms have large balconies, with at least half having beautiful views of the mountains. Our rooms was clean, though not large. There was a full set of towels, including washcloths, and two good-sized bars of soaps (in contrast to what seems to be common in Europe). Our room was extremely quiet. The only negative was that the single blanket in a case, no separate sheets/blankets (this seems to be the standard in Europe). The "continental breakfast" was fantastic, comparable only to the best "full American breakfast" I have had in a hotel (Hampton Inn downtown Nashville).
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel with a friendly, helpful staff. The nicest features were the cozy reception area with fireplace and a balcony in our large room looking out to the mountains (though not the Matterhorn if you are picky). It is centrally located on the main road in Zermatt near the train station and 5-10 minutes walk from the ski slopes. (Although Zermatt is so tiny that I think every hotel there would be classified as "centrally located". The breakfast buffet was nice too. I love this hotel!
reviews.title: The Beautiful Butterfly

likes.liked: — Nice room, cozy reception area, general decor

reviews.title: Solid choice for skiiers
reviews.text: Spent a long weekend here at the end of a business trip to do some skiing. The location is not bad being close to the train station and some shopping, but it is a LONG hike to get to the gondola in the morning--particularly in ski boots. If you're planning to hit the lower slopes, the location is better.
The staff is nice and hotel is dated, but clean. Rooms are pretty spartan and the club is dark/dated. If you want a place with apres skiing, look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: I am putting in my first review of a hotel after using this website for many years. We stayed here in mid Jan 2009 on our first family skiing trip. Two daughters (13 & 16) and my parents.Firstly and mainly the reason for writing a review is that this was possibly the friendliest and most helpful hotel we have ever stayed in. We generally stay in 4* plus accomadation but have never been treated so well as we were here.We are all vegetarians and this is always tricky wherever we go but not here. The waiter Arnaldo could not do enough for us.We had a five course menu which despite been set was tailored for us exceptionaly well with fresh pastas,risotto and vegetables on our menu every day.The chef is Italian which is great for us.There is little point in me expanding too much as there is nothing bad I can say about this place, read the previous review (12 Jan) as I agree entirely. The bar area is also excellent wth a relaxed atmosphere and comfortable sofas. If you do decide to come to Zermatt you will not go wrong here for a very friendly,clean,well run and lovely place to stay.
reviews.title: 3 star acts like 5

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Le Petite hotel but due to building work they moved us to Butterfly. Receptionist was friendly, rooms clean and loction excellent. Breakfast was typically Swiss and service good.
reviews.title: Unexpected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend to my friends to stay here.
reviews.title: Hotel Butterfly Outstanding for a Three-Star Establishment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed courtesy of Inghams for a fortnight at the Hotel Butterfly in the first half of September 2009, during a period of excellent weather. We had taken heed of previous good reviews in TripAdvisor and these proved to be reliable. The room though of medium-size was well-planned, with plenty of space to store our clothes. It had a balcony which looked up to the Riffelalp and Trockener Steg, albeit over other buildings. The hotel is in a remarkably quiet part of town, even though it is only 75 yards from the main street, the Bahnhofstrasse. Food was very good and the service outstanding, thanks to the Maitre Arnaldo and his courteous and well-trained and marshalled staff. Nothing in Switzerland is inexpensive, but the Butterfly gave us very good value for money which is what matters.
reviews.title: Much more than a Best Western…

reviews.text: Fantastically located a short-enough-to-drag-your-bags walk from the train station and the Gornergrat – great to experience once, but too slow to be repeated again, we used the bus which leaves just outside the Gornergrat to head up to Sunnegga and Schwarzsee and by the end of the week we’d had enough of the bus and were sharing an electric taxi with other guests from the hotel.
reviews.title: Good value & quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The delightful Verena (I think!) on reception could not be more helpful and provided the easiest and quickest lift pass service I’ve experienced in 25 odd years! She seemed to be on duty 24 / 7, she was there when we went to bed and was back behind reception looking ever so spritely when we came down for breakfast!
reviews.title: carole and malcolm stoke on trent
Great Mid Priced Zermatt hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is one on my all time BEST BUY list. I consider it to be a mid ranked hotel, 3 out of 5 stars. Hotel is mid priced in a high priced market. I consider the hotel to actually be one of the better samples of a mid ranked property. It is bookable online through Best Western, which means it is a small, independently owned property (as are all properties on the Best Western network).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is a little hard to find. Once one comes off the Täsch train and goes straight ahead through the little square onto the main drag, the hotel is off to the right on a 20 meter alley by an electronics store (it used to have expensive Sony TVs in the window when I was there 3 yrs ago, but may have changed).
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel closes main doors during the night, and front desk it not staffed. If you need to leave early to go on the sunrise trip, or just want to check out early, talk to the very nice front desk ladies the night before, and they will advise how these things can be done (there are tricks they will tell you about).
reviews.title: Beautiful Butterfly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Butterfly is a charming hotel just off the main road in Zermatt, close to the train station and Gornergrat station. The rooms have their own bathroom (with soap and shampoo), something we're used to in the US. The rooms also had flat screen TVs. A breakfast was provided every morning in the restaurant on the first level of the hotel...fresh rolls, cheeses, cold cuts, jams, yogurt/granola, juice, coffee, etc. Everyone at the hotel counter spoke very good english (we really appreciate that!). Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in great location

reviews.text: Once again we stayed in the Butterfly and could not have been happier. This time Vreni's daughter was at the reception, and much to our delight we were upgraded from our standard room to a suite on the top floor that comprised a foyer, a bedroom, a sitting area and a spacious bathroom and a double balcony. As before, everything at the Butterfly is spotless. The team in the dining room were the same as the year before and are just as courteous and enthusiastic and cheerful. The breakfasts are good and the evening meals superb and great value for money. Frank holds court in the bar and ensures that everyone feels special.
reviews.title: Best hotel we had in Switzerland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at Hotel Butterfly this September and absolutely loved our brief stay. Zermatt is a charming Swiss mountain town that has fabulous views of the Matterhorn and easy access to the mountains. Hotel Butterfly is minutes away from the train station and the rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean. The staff were warm, friendly and eager to assist. I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: loved the Butterfly

reviews.text: A very convenient place to stay in Zermatt. The staff were friendly and the room was very satisfactory. There was building work going on outside the hotel and we requested a room change because of this. This was readily organised.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Hotel Butterfly
